page.title: 14Milton Ernest Changing Times
page.content: In{1900}fire engines were powered by steam and pulled by horses. Water was drawn from the river. Only men were allowed to vote. The main road was dusty and rutted with cart tracks. Cars were rare. Radwell Road flooded to 4 feet. Trains were lit through the roof by gas lamps and were steam powered. Streets were gas lit. Scarlet fever, tuberculosis, diptheria, polio, smallpox and whooping cough were common. In{l985}fire engines are motorised and water comes from fire hydrants. Anyone over the age of 18 may vote. The tarmaccadammed A6 is full of traffic (see A6 survey). Radwell Road still floods. Trains are electrically lit and powered by diesel or electricty. Streets are electrically lit. People are vaccinated against diseases.
